intro: Ibervillea tenuisecta, commonly known as the slenderleaf ibervillea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and other succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are reduced to spines, a common adaptation for water conservation in arid environments. Ibervillea tenuisecta is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
